item.title: Highly skilled South African women opt for emigration
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
SOUTH Africa has the highest number of highly skilled women professionals of any African country who are emigrating to other countries because of limited career opportunities at home. This is according to an analysis of data by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), which shows the migration patterns between all African countries and […]

The post Highly skilled South African women opt for emigration appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: Metros falling way behind in issuing of property title deeds
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
Administrative problems, together with a failure to root out abuse of the housing allocation system, is tripping up the delivery of title deeds to beneficiaries in the country’s cities, with one metro failing to hand over any title deeds in two years. Human Settlements Minister Lindiwe Sisulu told MPs in a recent written reply to […]

The post Metros falling way behind in issuing of property title deeds appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: State fiscal outlook “unaffordable”
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
The size and cost of the South African public service has grown so unwieldy that the country is 4 million taxpayers short of affording to maintain it in its current state. This is according to an analysis of data from the South African Revenue Service and Statistics South Africa, for the years 2009 and 2012, […]

The post State fiscal outlook “unaffordable” appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: My Data Adventure in Three Words: FML
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
Twenty eight data sets: that is the amount of data we had to look through to get an interesting slice of insight into South African professionals leaving the country to work abroad. To say that data journalism is the next critical form of storytelling in reporting and that it will eventually transform the way all news rooms operate would be a […]

The post My Data Adventure in Three Words: FML appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.

item.title: The exodus of teachers from SA is not slowing down
item.dc:creator: Khulekani Magubane
item.description:
SA is losing thousands of teachers annually, and most are headed to the United Kingdom. Teachers battling to get by in SA are opting to relocate to the UK, Australia, Canada and other countries where they can earn better salaries, save money or make enough to pay off their debts, according to data analysis conducted […]

The post The exodus of teachers from SA is not slowing down appeared first on Code for South Africa Data Journalism Academy.
